se350.elevatorSim.build

Class ControlBox

  • java.lang.Object
    • se350.elevatorSim.build.ControlBox

  • public class ControlBox
extends java.lang.Object
    Class that represents the ControlBox on each Floor of the building. A User presses the ControlBox, either up or down, sending the ElevatorController a request that it must delegate and assign to an Elevator.
    Author:
    James Hagle

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ControlBox(int floor)
      Simple Constructor that sets the floor of this ControlBox

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getFloor()
      Get the floor of Floor that the ControlBox is on
      void pressDown()
      Simulates the Person pressing down on the ControlBox.
      void pressUp()
      Simulates the Person pressing up on the ControlBox.

      • ControlBox

        public ControlBox(int floor)
           throws InvalidParameterException
        Simple Constructor that sets the floor of this ControlBox

    • Method Detail

      • pressUp

        public void pressUp()
             throws InvalidParameterException
        Simulates the Person pressing up on the ControlBox. Sends a new request to the ElevatorController for processing.
        Throws:
        InvalidParameterException - - if the floor is not a valid Floor

      • pressDown

        public void pressDown()
               throws InvalidParameterException
        Simulates the Person pressing down on the ControlBox. Sends a new request to the ElevatorController for processing.
        Throws:
        InvalidParameterException - - if the floorNum is not a valid Floor

      • getFloor

        public int getFloor()
        Get the floor of Floor that the ControlBox is on
        Returns:
        The floor of the Floor that the ControlBox is on.
